# Gospel Meditations - Podcast Brand Specifications

**Podcast Name:** Gospel Meditations
**Domain:** gm.opencat.org
**Description:** 5-minute meditations on the Catholic Faith, Mark's Gospel, and the Rosary

---

## Brand Overview

Gospel Meditations is a contemplative podcast offering short, focused meditations to help listeners deepen their Catholic faith. The brand evokes:

- **Serenity** - Peaceful, calming presence
- **Tradition** - Rooted in Catholic heritage
- **Accessibility** - Brief, approachable content
- **Reverence** - Sacred and meaningful

---

## Color Palette

| Color | Name | Hex Code | Usage |
|-------|------|----------|-------|
| ![#1a3a5c](https://via.placeholder.com/20/1a3a5c/1a3a5c) | Marian Blue | `#1a3a5c` | Primary - Headers, buttons, backgrounds |
| ![#c9a227](https://via.placeholder.com/20/c9a227/c9a227) | Sacred Gold | `#c9a227` | Secondary - Accents, highlights, borders |
| ![#f8f6f1](https://via.placeholder.com/20/f8f6f1/f8f6f1) | Parchment Cream | `#f8f6f1` | Background - Main background, cards |
| ![#8b4557](https://via.placeholder.com/20/8b4557/8b4557) | Rosary Rose | `#8b4557` | Accent - Call-to-actions, special highlights |
| ![#2c2c2c](https://via.placeholder.com/20/2c2c2c/2c2c2c) | Scripture Dark | `#2c2c2c` | Text - Body copy, readable content |

### Color Psychology

- **Marian Blue**: Associated with the Virgin Mary, represents faith, devotion, and heavenly contemplation
- **Sacred Gold**: Represents divine light, illumination, and the sacred (used in illuminated manuscripts)
- **Parchment Cream**: Evokes ancient texts, tradition, and warmth
- **Rosary Rose**: Connects to Marian devotion and the mysteries of the Rosary

---

## Typography

### Primary Font (Headings)
**Cormorant Garamond**
- Weight: 600 (semi-bold) for titles
- Weight: 400 (regular) for subheadings
- Style: Elegant, liturgical feel
- Fallback: Georgia, "Times New Roman", serif

### Secondary Font (Body)
**Open Sans**
- Weight: 400 (regular) for body text
- Weight: 600 (semi-bold) for emphasis
- Style: Clean, highly readable
- Fallback: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, "Segoe UI", Roboto, sans-serif

### Font Pairing Rationale
The contrast between the elegant Cormorant Garamond (evoking traditional liturgical texts) and the clean Open Sans (ensuring accessibility) creates a balance of reverence and readability.

---

## Podcast Artwork Specifications

### Cover Art Requirements

| Platform | Dimensions | Format | File Size |
|----------|------------|--------|-----------|
| **Apple Podcasts** | 3000 x 3000 px | JPG/PNG | < 512KB |
| **Spotify** | 3000 x 3000 px | JPG | < 200KB |
| **Google Podcasts** | 1400 x 1400 px (min) | JPG/PNG | < 10MB |
| **Web/General** | 1400 x 1400 px | JPG/PNG/WebP | < 500KB |
| **Thumbnail** | 300 x 300 px | JPG/PNG | < 100KB |

### Cover Art Design Elements

```
+------------------------------------------+
|                                          |
|     [Subtle cross or dove symbol]        |
|                                          |
|        GOSPEL MEDITATIONS                |
|           (Cormorant Garamond)           |
|                                          |
|   - - - [decorative gold line] - - -    |
|                                          |
|      5-Minute Catholic Reflections       |
|           (Open Sans, smaller)           |
|                                          |
|     [Optional: rosary bead imagery]      |
|                                          |
+------------------------------------------+

Background: Gradient from #1a3a5c to #0d1f30
Text: #f8f6f1 (cream)
Accent elements: #c9a227 (gold)
```

### Recommended Visual Elements

1. **Cross or Dove** - Subtle, not dominating (top or center)
2. **Gold accent line** - Below the main title
3. **Rosary beads** - Subtle pattern or single bead as decoration
4. **Gospel book** - Open book silhouette (optional)
5. **Soft radiance** - Subtle glow effect around text

### What to Avoid

- Overly complex imagery (hard to read at small sizes)
- Multiple fonts
- Bright, jarring colors
- Excessive text
- Low-contrast combinations

---

## Episode Artwork (Optional)

For episode-specific artwork:

| Series | Suggested Element |
|--------|-------------------|
| Mark's Gospel | Open book with highlighted text |
| Rosary Mysteries | Rosary beads, specific mystery imagery |
| Catholic Faith | Church/cathedral silhouette |
| Seasonal | Liturgical colors (purple for Lent, etc.) |

---

## Audio Branding

### Intro/Outro Music Recommendations

**Style:**
- Gentle, contemplative
- Acoustic or orchestral
- 3-5 seconds intro, 5-10 seconds outro

**Mood:**
- Peaceful, not dramatic
- Inviting, warm
- Reverent but accessible

**Suggested Instruments:**
- Soft piano
- Gentle strings
- Acoustic guitar
- Chimes or bells (subtle)

### Audio Format Specifications

| Setting | Value |
|---------|-------|
| Format | MP3 |
| Bitrate | 128 kbps (mono) or 192 kbps (stereo) |
| Sample Rate | 44.1 kHz |
| Channels | Mono (recommended for voice) |
| Loudness | -16 LUFS (for podcast platforms) |

### Social Media Templates

Create templates using the Gospel Meditations color palette for:
- Episode announcements
- Scripture quotes
- Weekly meditation previews
- Feast day specials

---

## Website Integration

### Castopod Theme

The custom CSS file `gospel-meditations-castopod.css` provides:
- Color variables matching the brand
- Typography setup with Google Fonts
- Styled episode cards
- Custom audio player styling
- Responsive design
- Dark mode support

### Installation

1. Copy the CSS content to Castopod Admin > Settings > Theme
2. Or upload as a custom stylesheet
3. Ensure Google Fonts are allowed (or self-host the fonts)

---

## RSS Feed Metadata

```xml
<channel>
  <title>Gospel Meditations</title>
  <description>5-minute meditations on the Catholic Faith, Mark's Gospel, and the Rosary. Find peace and deepen your faith with brief daily reflections.</description>
  <itunes:author>Gospel Meditations</itunes:author>
  <itunes:category text="Religion &amp; Spirituality">
    <itunes:category text="Christianity"/>
  </itunes:category>
  <itunes:explicit>no</itunes:explicit>
  <language>en-us</language>
</channel>
```
